conclusion: Determine how shadows will change when light source moves to back left above objects
Shadow A is cast by the white rectangular object, located to the right of the object
Shadow B is cast by the chair-like object, located to the right of the object
Shadow C is cast by the ring-like object, located below and slightly to the right of the object
Shadow D is cast by the avocado, located to the right of the object
Light source moves to back left above objects, changing direction of light rays
Shadow A will shift to the front right of the white rectangular object
Shadow B will shift to the front right of the chair-like object
Shadow C will shift to the front right of the ring-like object
Shadow D will shift to the front right of the avocado
Final answer: Shadows A, B, C, and D will shift to the front right of their respective objects
